intro: Chamisme purpurea, commonly known as purple chamomile, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with purple petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Chamisme purpurea is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal remedies.
